H0.text: who is the father of genetics and what did he study. Charles Darwin

H1.text: who is the father of genetics and what did he study. Gregor Johann Mendel's contemporary, Carl Linnaeus

H2.text: who is the father of genetics and what did he study. Theodor Boveri

H3.text: who is the father of genetics and what did he study. Mendel

A4.text: Gregor Johann Mendel is known as the 'father of modern genetics.'

A5.text: Mendel studied variation in plants, focusing on seven traits such as seed shape, flower color, and plant height.
